reviews.text: I came to the Roosevelt Inn as part of a women's walking trip in May 2007. I didn't know what to expect from a small motel. What I found was:
reviews.title: The Best Little Motel In the World!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and convenience to all attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Excellent Value

likes.liked: — The price, location and pleasant owners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Best stay for the money!
The only place we'll stay when we are in the area!
Excellent motel
reviews.text: The Roosevelt Inn at Hyde Park, NY is one of the cleanest, best maintained motels I have ever encountered. The buildings and rooms are immaculate. The motel is an older, 1950's-60's style without a lot of amenities and somewhat plain rooms, but the place is family owned and run and the proprietors show great pride in their business. The room was very spacious, TV worked just fine, and the bathroom was sparkling. Self-serve breakfast (coffee, rolls, bagels) is provided in a large, clean room. The motel is near the town center of Hyde Park, and a few blocks from the FDR home and library. The quality-to-price ratio is very high.
